title: TurtleCoin Official Podcast
description: The latest news about TurtleCoin, a safe, fun and easy to use cryptocurrency as well chats about software development, blockchain mechanics, and other general shenanigans

items.title: How did you hear about TurtleCoin?
items.description: This week, MetaPrinter ran a contest on the TRTL Reddit to see who had the best 'This is how I heard about TurtleCoin' story, with plenty of TRTL for the winners!

items.title: Decimals and Dusty Shells
items.description: Join us for a discussion about why TRTL has only 2 digits after the decimal and the 100,000:1 supply reduction.

items.title: v2 Community AMA
items.description: We got a lot of questions and comments after the last episode, so this time around we consulted the community with guest TurtleTurtle.club

items.title: Proof of Waste
items.description: Let's talk about fungibility and how it helps to avoid Proof of Waste

items.title: My Blockchain Is Smaller Than Yours
items.description: Join us today for a chat about the new pruning technology coming in TRTLv2 and a whole lot of other topics you might not understand!

items.title: Shitcoin Forkers!
items.description: Today we talk about open source licensing, shitcoin forkers, and the damage they do to the community. Peppered in is a bit about how v2 staking rewards work.

items.title: Shell Shopped
items.description: This week we invited along a few guests: LowIQMonkey and TTC, who came on to talk about Shell Shop, a new e-commerce solution to set up your own store and sell things for TRTL easily using TurtlePay. TTC also joins us to give the TurtleCoin Mining State Of The Union.

items.title: The Struggle Is Real
items.description: This week we bring you a development update, talk about the struggle of maintaining a large community, and bring in a new guest who found his way to TurtleTurtle.club and is helping out in a few places

items.title: From Zero To Blockchain
items.description: After a bit of a recording hiatus, we're back for a long talk about blockchain fundamentals including consensus mechanisms, transactions, incentivizing participation, account, keys, and chickens.

items.title: The Struggle is Real - Part 2
items.description: We're back again this week discussing a v2 development timeline update, the struggle of balancing priorities, and what that means for the community.
